result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd J Baker

records.addlTxt:

22CM32 & 22CM83 tracking together:
Atty Zamzow states that the offer includes some upfront counseling and an assessment; requests another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:33 PM Defendant Todd J Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow appeared by video for Todd J Baker.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CM32 tracking with 22CM83:

22CM83:
Atty Zamzow states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Zamzow enters a Not Guilty plea.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Repay Attorney fees

records.addlTxt:
1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Todd J Baker appeared by video. 
Defendant did receive an offer from the State and does not wish to accept that offer.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant states that he can't get an Attorney.  Court advises the different ways of getting an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Clerk to send court appointed Attorney paperwork with notice
set status
Status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:40 PM Defendant Todd J Baker appeared by video.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant did not receive that offer. Atty Burdon states that an offer was done this morning and is being sent out.

BY THE COURT:  RESET
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney and has received an offer from the State.  Court questions defendant and finds he is freely, voluntarily & intelligently waiving his right to counsel.
  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.

01:45 PM Defendant Todd J Baker appeared by video means (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Also appearing is Attorney Mark Gumz on behalf of the defendant for purposes of today's hearing only.  
Atty Burdon request $500 signature bond with conditions.  No objections by Atty Gumz.  Court questions defendant. BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions.
  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1 or Witness 1.   *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol
